author: aktzbn
body:
We are using **pwsh 6.2.0** (checked on **6.2.2** also) on **Debian 9**. And sometime troubles with start appear - command prompt never appear.

Last line of  calling ` strace pwsh` contains `futex(0xe84b64, FUTEX_WAIT_PRIVATE, 3, NULL` .

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Looks like .Net Core issue. Please open new issue in CoreCLR repo, add more info (maybe trace too) and reference the issue there.

@SteveL-MSFT Who could look the issue?

comments.author: aktzbn
comments.body:
> Looks like .Net Core issue. Please open new issue in CoreCLR repo, add more info (maybe trace too) and reference the issue there.
> 
> @SteveL-MSFT Who could look the issue?

@iSazonov, could you suggest what info to add and how to obtain it?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @aktzbn I hope .Net Core experts help you. Perhaps they request a dump https://superuser.com/questions/401182/how-can-i-create-a-dump-file-of-a-running-process-in-linux

comments.author: aktzbn
comments.body: Close issue because problem currently disappear and no way to gather additional info.

comments.author: aktzbn
comments.body:
So, now it is clear that this was due unavailable mount. `pwsh` is touching each mount and is hanging on the first unavailable. Other shells are able to start at least

Out CI cluster (`Azure Devops`) did not work for several day until we realized what problem was in.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: pwsh hangs on start on Debian 9
